definition:
at what time                                      
             
             when will you return
at or during which time
and then

at a former and usually less prosperous time                                      
             
             brag fondly of having known him when

at or during the time that : while                                      
             
             went fishing when he was a boy

just at the moment that                                      
             
             stop writing when the bell rings

at any or every time that                                      
             
             when he listens to music, he falls asleep

in the event that : if                                      
             
             a contestant is disqualified when he disobeys the rules

considering that                                      
             
             why use water at all when you can drown in it

in spite of the fact that : although                                      
             
             quit politics when I might have had a great career in it

the time or occasion at or in which                                      
             
             tomorrow is when we must decide

what or which time                                      
             
             life-long homes for those … who have lived here since when

the time in which something is done or comes about                                      
             
             troubled his head very little about the hows and whens of life
at what time
at, in, or during which
at or during the time that
just after the time that
at any or every time that
what or which time

at what time                                      
             
             When did you leave?

the time at which                                      
             
             I was not sure of when they'd come.

at, in, or during which                                      
             
             It was hard to remember the time when they hadn't played that game …

at, during, or just after the time that                                      
             
             She wants to leave when I do.

in the event that : if                                      
             
             When you have a question, raise your hand.

although sense 1                                      
             
             Why do you tease, when you know it's wrong?

the time at which                                      
             
             Tomorrow is when we leave.

what or which time                                      
             
             Since when have you been an expert?
in: when will you return
brag fondly of having known him when
went fishing when he was a boy
stop writing when the bell rings
when he listens to music, he falls asleep
a contestant is disqualified when he disobeys the rules
why use water at all when you can drown in it
quit politics when I might have had a great career in it
tomorrow is when we must decide
humor is when you laugh
life-long homes for those … who have lived here since when
troubled his head very little about the hows and whens of life
When did the American Civil War begin?
The detective asked me when I last saw her.
When is the next performance?
It was a time when people didn't have to lock their doors.
the happy days when we were together
We're still waiting for the test results, when we'll decide our next move.
When he finally showed up, he was drunk.
When I was in school, we didn't have computers.
You can go when the bell rings.
Call me when you get home.
Things were better when he got a job.
When he watches television, he falls asleep.
She quit politics when she might have had a great career in it.
He retired in 1998, since when he has been devoting his time to gardening.
You need the report by when?
When did you leave?
I was not sure of when they'd come.
It was hard to remember the time when they hadn't played that game …
She wants to leave when I do.
When you have a question, raise your hand.
Why do you tease, when you know it's wrong?
Tomorrow is when we leave.
Since when have you been an expert?

definition: used for asking at what time something happens
used for asking in what kind of situation something happens
used when someone knows or says at what time something happens, or in what situation it happens
as soon as another action or event has finished
at the same time as something else
at a point during the time that something else is happening
used for talking about a particular time or situation
used for introducing a situation that makes someone’s action or behaviour seem surprising
used for making a general statement about something that is always true or correct
in: When will we know our test results?
When did the trouble start?
I asked him when he was going to start work.
‘You’ll get your money back.’ ‘Yes, but when?’
since when: Since when have you been in charge of the project?
When should I end a letter with ‘Yours sincerely’?
When is it OK to hug someone that you’ve just met?
He didn’t say when they would leave.
It is important to know when you have had enough to drink.
When it stops raining, I’ll show you the garden.
I always wear a hat when I work in the garden.
when doing something: She was often nervous when facing the camera.
She claims she was at a friend’s house when the shooting took place.
The biggest surprise for Josie was when she was chosen as team captain.
the time/day/year etc when: Do you remember the time when we took your mother camping?
There are some days when everything seems to go wrong.
Why does she always drive to work when she could easily take the train?
He went on protesting his innocence when he was obviously guilty.
We use ‘an’ when the next word begins with a vowel.
Tonic water makes a refreshing drink when served with ice and lemon.

definition: at what time; at the time at which:
what/which time:
considering the fact that:
despite the fact that:
in: "I did tell you about it." "When? I don't remember."

I went there when I was a child.

I don't understand how he can say that everything's fine when it's so obvious that it's not.

He says he hasn’t got any money when the truth is he’s got plenty.
